org.modelio.api.module

Interface IModuleService


  • public interface IModuleService
    This interface defines how to get the public interface from modules.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Collection<IPeerModule> getAllPeerModules()
      Returns the list of deployed peer module.
      <T extends IPeerModule> 
      T      		 getPeerModule(Class<T> peerClass)
      Get the public services of a specific Java module.
      IPeerModule getPeerModule(String moduleName)
      Get the public services of a specific Java module from its name.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllPeerModules

        Collection<IPeerModule> getAllPeerModules()
        Returns the list of deployed peer module.
        Returns:
        the collection of deployed peer modules.

      • getPeerModule

        <T extends IPeerModule> T getPeerModule(Class<T> peerClass)
        Get the public services of a specific Java module.

        This method needs the concrete interface of a module to return the loaded instance of this peer module.

        For example, the following example shows a call of this method to return a specific module named MyMDAC:

        IModelingSession session = Modelio.getInstance().getModelingSession();
        IMyMDACPeerModule peerModule = (IMyMDACPeerModule)session.getModuleService().getPeerModule(IMyMDACPeerModule.class);

        The returned peer module can be casted without risk to the right desired module, but only if a dependency exists between the returned module, and the one requesting the peer.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The peer module type.
        Parameters:
        peerClass - The peer module class.
        Returns:
        the peer module regarding the given metaclass. Might be NullPointerException if no such module is loaded.

      • getPeerModule

        IPeerModule getPeerModule(String moduleName)
        Get the public services of a specific Java module from its name.

        The returned peer module can be casted without risk to the right desired module, but only if a dependency exists between the returned module, and the one requesting the peer.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The module name.
        Returns:
        the peer module regarding the given metaclass. Might be NullPointerException if no such module is loaded.
        Since:
        2.2
